102871 old ¦ a coin, <ls>L.</ls> (In the <s1 slp1="brAhmaRa">Brāhmaṇa</s1>s, <s>indu</s> is used only for the moon; but the connexion between the meanings ‘<s1 slp1="soma">Soma</s1> juice’ and ‘moon’ in the word <s>indu</s> has led to the same two ideas being transferred in classical <ns>Sanskṛt</ns> to the word <s>soma</s>, although the latter has properly only the sense ‘<s1 slp1="soma">Soma</s1> juice.’)<info lex="inh"/>

243442 old <s>cana/</s> ¦ <lex>ind.</lex> (<s>ca na/</s>, <ls>SV.</ls>) and not, also not, even not, not even (this particle is placed after the word to which it gives force; a preceding verb is accentuated [<ls>Pāṇ. viii, 1, 57</ls>]; in Vedic language it is generally, but not always, found without any other <ab>neg.</ab> particle, whereas in the later language another <ab>neg.</ab> is usually added <ab>e.g.</ab> <s>A/paS cana/pra/ minanti vrata/M vAM</s>, ‘not even the waters violate your ordinance’ <ls>RV. ii, 24, 12</ls>; <s>nA/<srs/>ha vivyAca pfTivI/ canE/<srs/>naM</s>, ‘the earth even does not contain him’, <ls n="RV.">iii, 36, 4</ls>; in <ab>class.</ab> <ns>Sanskṛt</ns> it is only used after the interrogatives <s>ka/</s>, <s>katara/</s>, <s>katama/</s>, <s>kaTam</s>, <s>ka/d</s>, <s>kadA/</s>, <s>kim</s>, <s>ku/tas</s>, <s>kva</s>, making them indefinite), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> &c. also, <ls>RV. i, 139, 2</ls>; <ls n="RV.">vi, 26, 7</ls>; <ls n="RV.">viii, 78, 10.</ls><info lex="ind"/>

; <L>28801.2<pc>165,2<k1>idam
102617 old ¦ (opposed to <s>adas</s> <ab>e.g.</ab> <s>ayaM lokaH</s> or <s>idaM viSvam</s> or <s>idaM sarvam</s>, this earthly world, this universe; <s>ayam agniH</s>, this fire which burns on the earth; but <s>asAv agniH</s>, that fire in the sky, <ab>i.e.</ab> the lightning: so also <s>idam</s> or <s>iyam</s> alone sometimes signifies ‘this earth’; <s>ime smaH</s>, here we are.) <s>idam</s> often refers to something immediately following, whereas <s>etad</s> points to what precedes (<ab>e.g.</ab> <s>SrutvE<srs/>tad idam UcuH</s>, having heard that they said this). <s>idam</s> occurs connected with <s>yad</s>, <s>tad</s>, <s>etad</s>, <s>kim</s>, and a personal pronoun, partly to point out anything more distinctly and emphatically, partly pleonastically (<ab>e.g.</ab> <s>tad idaM vAkyam</s>, this speech here following <pb n="165,3"/>; <s>so 'yaM vidUzakaH</s>, this <s1 slp1="vidUzaka">Vidūṣaka</s1> here).

102392 old <div n="p"/><s>i/ti</s> may form an adverbial compound with the name of an author (<ab>e.g.</ab> <s>i/ti-pARini</s>, thus according to <s1 slp1="pARini">Pāṇini</s1>).
